conclusion: Identify the given information: semi-circular glass brick with radius R, light incident at angle θ = 60° at point P, totally internally reflected, light parallel to incident light after exiting.
Determine the critical angle for total internal reflection: critical angle θc is the angle of incidence for total internal reflection, given by sin θc = 1/n.
Use the given information to find the refractive index n: light parallel to incident light implies 180-degree deviation, angle of incidence at circular surface equals critical angle θc.
Relate the critical angle to the given angle θ: angle of incidence at circular surface is 90° - θ, equals critical angle θc, so θc = 30°.
Calculate the refractive index n: using sin θc = 1/n, sin 30° = 1/2, so n = 2.
Determine the distance OP: distance OP is the perpendicular distance from center O to point P on circular surface, equal to radius R.
